intro: Monenteles, commonly known as the "scented fern," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers that bloom in early spring. The plants typically have slender, upright stems and are native to regions of eastern North America. Monenteles species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Their ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to forest understory biodiversity.
